page.title: 19PAST AND PRESENT IN HORTON
page.content: The{Grickstone}is the oldest thing in Horton. It marks the boundary. The frost is starting to wear it away. Iron Age people used to live on{Horton {Camp.}Now it is used to graze cattle. In 1844 a horse was ploughing and it fell down a hole,which was the{Long {Barrow.}They found some pottery and skeletons.In those days people were not interested in History so they filled the hole in.Horton was recorded in{Domesday Book,}which is so old that it is in a museum. The{Norman Hall}is the oldest part of{Horton Court.}The rest was built in the 16th Century. Near by are the Norman{rabbit warrens and{fish ponds.}The{old bridge}and {road}are in ruins now.People still worship in{Horton Church. Bodkin Hazel {Wood}has not got any of its old trees. It is used sometimes for motor bike scrambling. Katherine
